ITEM.Name: RedirectForReturnDis
ITEM.Help_text: From a workaround for GCC/C000005 issue for XV Core on CZ A0, setting MSRC001_1029 Decode Configuration (DE_CFG) bit 14 [DecfgNoRdrctForReturns] to 1

ITEM.Name: L2 TLB Associativity
ITEM.Help_text: 0 - L2 TLB ways [11:8] are fully associative. 1 - =L2 TLB ways [11:8] are 4K-only.

ITEM.Name: Platform First Error Handling
ITEM.Help_text: Enable/disable PFEH, cloak individual banks, and mask deferred error interrupts from each bank.

ITEM.Name: Core Performance Boost
ITEM.Help_text: Disable CPB

ITEM.Name: Global C-state Control
ITEM.Help_text: Controls IO based C-state generation and DF C-states.

ITEM.Name: Custom Core Pstates Legal Disclaimer
ITEM.Help_text: Legal Disclaimer
ITEM.Additional_information: WARNING - DAMAGE CAUSED BY USE OF YOUR AMD PROCESSOR OUTSIDE OF SPECIFICATION OR IN EXCESS OF FACTORY SETTINGS ARE NOT COVERED UNDER YOUR AMD PRODUCT WARRANTY AND MAY NOT BE COVERED BY YOUR SYSTEM MANUFACTURER'S WARRANTY.

ITEM.Name: Custom Core Pstates Legal Disclaimer 1
ITEM.Help_text: Legal Disclaimer
ITEM.Additional_information: Operating your AMD processor outside of specification or in excess of factory settings, including but not limited to overclocking, may damage or shorten the life of your processor or other system components, create system instabilities (e.g., data loss and corrupted images) and in extreme cases may result in total system failure. AMD does not provide support or service for issues or damages related to use of an AMD processor outside of processor specifications or in excess of factory settings.

ITEM.Name: Custom Pstate0
ITEM.Help_text:
Disable - disable this Pstate Custom - customize this Pstate, applicable only if PcdOcDisable=FALSE
WARNING - DAMAGE CAUSED BY USE OF YOUR AMD PROCESSOR OUTSIDE OF SPECIFICATION OR IN EXCESS OF FACTORY SETTINGS ARE NOT COVERED UNDER YOUR AMD PRODUCT WARRANTY AND MAY NOT BE COVERED BY YOUR SYSTEM MANUFACTURER'S WARRANTY. Operating your AMD processor outside of specification or in excess of factory settings, including but not limited to overclocking, may damage or shorten the life of your processor or other system components, create system instabilities (e.g., data loss and corrupted images) and in extreme cases may result in total system failure. AMD does not provide support or service for issues or damages related to use of an AMD processor outside of processor specifications or in excess of factory settings.

ITEM.Name: Frequency (MHz)
ITEM.Help_text: Current core frequency in MHz

ITEM.Name: Voltage (uV)
ITEM.Help_text: Voltage in uV (1V = 1000 * 1000 uV)

ITEM.Name: Pstate0 FID
ITEM.Help_text: Specifies the core frequency multiplier. COF = 200MHz * FID / DID

ITEM.Name: Pstate0 DID
ITEM.Help_text: Specifies the core frequency divisor (DID[0] should zero if DID[5:0]>1Ah).

ITEM.Name: Pstate0 VID
ITEM.Help_text: Specifies the core voltage.

ITEM.Name: Custom Pstate1
ITEM.Help_text:
Disabled - disable this Pstate Custom - customize this Pstate, applicable only if PcdOcDisable=FALSE

ITEM.Name: Pstate7 FID
ITEM.Help_text: Specifies the core frequency multiplier. COF = 200MHz * FID / DID

ITEM.Name: Relaxed EDC throttling
ITEM.Help_text: Disabled - Part-specific EDC throttling protection enabled Enabled - Reduce the amount of time the processor will throttle Auto - AMD's recommendation (Disabled)

ITEM.Name: Core/Thread Enablement Legal Disclaimer
ITEM.Help_text: Legal Disclaimer
ITEM.Additional_information: WARNING - S3 is NOT SUPPORTED on systems where cores/threads have been removed/disabled.

ITEM.Name: Downcore control
ITEM.Help_text: Sets the number of cores to be used. Once this option has been used to remove any cores, a POWER CYCLE is required in order for future selections to take effect.\nNOTE: Need to set "CBS -> FCH Common Options -> System Control -> Toggle All PwrGood On Cf9" as disabled.
ITEM.Additional_information: Cores may be downcored (removed) through a warm reset. Once this option has been used to remove any cores, a POWER CYCLE is required in order for future selections to take effect.

ITEM.Name: SMTEN
ITEM.Help_text: Can be used to disable symmetric multithreading. To re-enable SMT, a POWER CYCLE is needed after selecting the "Auto" option.\nWARNING - S3 is NOT SUPPORTED on systems where SMT is disabled.\nNOTE: Need to set "CBS -> FCH Common Options -> System Control -> Toggle All PwrGood On Cf9" as disabled.

ITEM.Name: Streaming Stores Control
ITEM.Help_text: Enables or disables the streaming stores functionality

ITEM.Name: Enable IBS
ITEM.Help_text: When IBS is enabled, SpecLockMap and Stack Engine are disabled.

ITEM.Name: DRAM scrub time
ITEM.Help_text: Provide a value that is the number of hours to scrub memory.

ITEM.Name: Redirect scrubber control
ITEM.Help_text: Control DF::RedirScrubCtrl[EnRedirScrub]

ITEM.Name: Disable DF sync flood propagation
ITEM.Help_text: Control DF::PIEConfig[DisSyncFloodProp]

ITEM.Name: GMI encryption control
ITEM.Help_text: Control GMI link encryption

ITEM.Name: xGMI encryption control
ITEM.Help_text: Control xGMI link encryption

ITEM.Name: CC6 memory region encryption
ITEM.Help_text: Control whether or not the CC6 save/restore memory is encrypted

ITEM.Name: Location of private memory regions
ITEM.Help_text: Controls whether or not the private memory regions (PSP, SMU and CC6) are at the top of DRAM or distributed. Note that distributed requires memory on all dies. Note that it will always be at the top of DRAM if some dies don't have memory regardless of this option's setting.

ITEM.Name: System probe filter
ITEM.Help_text: Controls whether or not the probe filter is enabled. Has no effect on parts where the probe filter is fuse disabled.

ITEM.Name: Memory interleaving
ITEM.Help_text: Controls fabric level memory interleaving (AUTO, none, channel, die, socket). Note that channel, die, and socket has requirements on memory populations and it will be ignored if the memory doesn't support the selected option.

ITEM.Name: Memory interleaving size
ITEM.Help_text: Controls the memory interleaving size. The valid values are AUTO, 256 bytes, 512 bytes, 1 Kbytes or 2Kbytes. This determines the starting address of the interleave (bit 8, 9, 10 or 11).

ITEM.Name: Channel interleaving hash
ITEM.Help_text: Controls whether or not the address bits are hashed during channel interleave mode. This field should not be used unless the interleaving is set to channel and the interleaving size is 256 or 512 bytes.

ITEM.Name: DF C-state control
ITEM.Help_text: Enable / disable DF C-states (DF::CstateControl[DfCstateDisable])

ITEM.Name: xGMI DLWM control
ITEM.Help_text: Controls xGMI dynamic link width management feature.

ITEM.Name: Freeze DF module queues on error
ITEM.Help_text: Controls DF::DfGlobalCtrl[DisImmSyncFloodOnFatalError] Disabling this option sets DF:DfGlobalCtrl[DisImmSyncFloodOnFatalError]

ITEM.Name: DRAM Timing Configuration Legal Disclaimer
ITEM.Additional_information: WARNING - DAMAGE CAUSED BY USE OF YOUR AMD PROCESSOR OUTSIDE OF SPECIFICATION OR IN EXCESS OF FACTORY SETTINGS ARE NOT COVERED UNDER YOUR AMD PRODUCT WARRANTY AND MAY NOT BE COVERED BY YOUR SYSTEM MANUFACTURER'S WARRANTY.

ITEM.Name: DRAM Timing Configuration Legal Disclaimer 1
ITEM.Additional_information: Operating your AMD processor outside of specification or in excess of factory settings, including but not limited to overclocking, may damage or shorten the life of your processor or other system components, create system instabilities (e.g., data loss and corrupted images) and in extreme cases may result in total system failure. AMD does not provide support or service for issues or damages related to use of an AMD processor outside of processor specifications or in excess of factory settings.

ITEM.Name: Overclock
ITEM.Help_text: Memory Overclock Settings

ITEM.Name: Memory Clock Speed
ITEM.Help_text: Set the memory clock frequency.

ITEM.Name: Tcl
ITEM.Help_text: Sets the tCL time.

ITEM.Name: Trcdrd
ITEM.Help_text: This sets the RAS# Active to CAS# read/write delay.

ITEM.Name: Trcdwr
ITEM.Help_text: This sets the RAS# Active to CAS# read/write delay.

ITEM.Name: Trp
ITEM.Help_text: Specify the row precharge time.

ITEM.Name: Tras
ITEM.Help_text: Specify the min RAS# active time.

ITEM.Name: Trc Ctrl
ITEM.Help_text: Specify Trc

ITEM.Name: Trc
ITEM.Help_text: Active to Active/Refresh Delay Time. Valid values 87h-1Dh.

ITEM.Name: TrrdS
ITEM.Help_text: Activate to Activate Delay Time, different bank group (tRRD_S)

ITEM.Name: TrrdL
ITEM.Help_text: Activate to Activate Delay Time, same bank group (tRRD_L)

ITEM.Name: Tfaw Ctrl
ITEM.Help_text: Specify Tfaw

ITEM.Name: Tfaw
ITEM.Help_text: Four Activate Window Time. Valid values 36h-6h.

ITEM.Name: TwtrS
ITEM.Help_text: Minimum Write to Read Time, different bank group

ITEM.Name: TwtrL
ITEM.Help_text: Minimum Write to Read Time, same bank group

ITEM.Name: Twr Ctrl
ITEM.Help_text: Specify Twr

ITEM.Name: Twr
ITEM.Help_text: Minimum Write Recovery Time. Valid value 51h-Ah

ITEM.Name: Trcpage Ctrl
ITEM.Help_text: Specify Trcpage

ITEM.Name: Trcpage
ITEM.Help_text: SDRAM Optional Features (tMAW, MAC). Valid value 3FFh - 0h

ITEM.Name: TrdrdScL Ctrl
ITEM.Help_text: Specify TrdrdScL

ITEM.Name: TrdrdScL
ITEM.Help_text: CAS to CAS Delay Time, same bank group. Valid values Fh-1h

ITEM.Name: TwrwrScL Ctrl
ITEM.Help_text: Specify TwrwrScL

ITEM.Name: TwrwrScL
ITEM.Help_text: CAS to CAS Delay Time, same bank group. Valid values 3Fh-1h

ITEM.Name: Trfc Ctrl
ITEM.Help_text: Specify Trfc

ITEM.Name: Trfc
ITEM.Help_text: Refresh Recovery Delay Time (tRFC1). Valid values 3DEh-3Ch

ITEM.Name: Trfc2 Ctrl
ITEM.Help_text: Specify Trfc2

ITEM.Name: Trfc2
ITEM.Help_text: Refresh Recovery Delay Time (tRFC2). Valid values 3DEh-3Ch

ITEM.Name: Trfc4 Ctrl
ITEM.Help_text: Specify Trfc4

ITEM.Name: Trfc4
ITEM.Help_text: Refresh Recovery Delay Time (tRFC4). Valid values 3DEh-3Ch

ITEM.Name: Fail_CNT
ITEM.Help_text: The number of training failure/retries required before boot from recovery mode

ITEM.Name: ProcODT
ITEM.Help_text: Specifies the Processor ODT

ITEM.Name: Trtp
ITEM.Help_text: Specifies the read CAS# to precharge time.

ITEM.Name: Tcke
ITEM.Help_text: Specifies the CKE minimum high and low pulse width in memory clock cycles.

ITEM.Name: TrdrdSc
ITEM.Help_text: write to write timing same DIMM same chip select.

ITEM.Name: TrdrdSd
ITEM.Help_text: write to write timing same DIMM same chip select.

ITEM.Name: TrdrdDd
ITEM.Help_text: write to write timing same DIMM same chip select.

ITEM.Name: TwrwrSc
ITEM.Help_text: write to write timing same DIMM same chip select.

ITEM.Name: TwrwrSd
ITEM.Help_text: write to write timing same DIMM same chip select.

ITEM.Name: TwrwrDd
ITEM.Help_text: write to write timing same DIMM same chip select.

ITEM.Name: Trdwr
ITEM.Help_text: This sets the tWRTTO time.

ITEM.Name: Twrrd
ITEM.Help_text: Specify the write to read delay when accessing different DIMMs.
ITEM.Additional_information: The register associated with this setup option is programmed immediately before the DRAM initialization bit is set in MCT code. See the note at the top of this section. This field along with D18F2x78[9:8] combine to specify a 4-bit value, Twrrd[3:0], when D18F2x94[Ddr3Mode]=1

ITEM.Name: Power Down Enable
ITEM.Help_text: Enable or disable DDR power down mode

ITEM.Name: Cmd2T
ITEM.Help_text: Select between 1T and 2T mode on ADDR/CMD

ITEM.Name: CAD Bus Timing User Controls
ITEM.Help_text: Setup time on CAD bus signals to Auto or Manual

ITEM.Name: AddrCmdSetup
ITEM.Help_text: Setup time on CAD bus signals. Valid values 3Fh-0h.

ITEM.Name: CsOdtSetup
ITEM.Help_text: Setup time on CAD bus signals. Valid values 3Fh-0h.

ITEM.Name: CkeSetup
ITEM.Help_text: Setup time on CAD bus signals. Valid values 3Fh-0h.

ITEM.Name: CAD Bus Drive Strength User Controls
ITEM.Help_text: Drive Strength on CAD bus signals to Auto or Manual

ITEM.Name: Data Bus Configuration User Controls
ITEM.Help_text: Specify the mode for drive strength to Auto or Manual

ITEM.Name: Data Poisoning
ITEM.Help_text: Enable/disable data poisoning: UMC_CH::EccCtrl[UcFatalEn] UMC_CH::EccCtrl[WrEccEn] Should be enabled/disabled together.

ITEM.Name: DRAM ECC Symbol Size
ITEM.Help_text: DRAM ECC Symbol Size (x4/x8) - UMC_CH::EccCtrl[EccSymbolSize]

ITEM.Name: DRAM ECC Enable
ITEM.Help_text: Use this option to enable / disable DRAM ECC. Auto will set ECC to enable.

ITEM.Name: TSME
ITEM.Help_text: Transparent SME: AddrTweakEn = 1; ForceEncrEn =0; DataEncrEn = 1

ITEM.Name: Chipselect Interleaving
ITEM.Help_text: Interleave memory blocks across the DRAM chip selects for node 0.
ITEM.Additional_information: The "Disabled" setting will prevent bank interleaving from being established. The "Auto" setting will allow the MCT code to determine if the DIMMs are capable of supporting the feature and then make the proper settings. If the DIMMs present in the system are not conducive to bank interleaving operation, then MCT code will not use interleave settings. Note: The backend code for this setup option must run before MCT and it is handled by the MCT wrapper.

ITEM.Name: Address Hash Bank
ITEM.Help_text: Enable or disable bank address hashing

ITEM.Name: Address Hash CS
ITEM.Help_text: Enable or disable CS address hashing

ITEM.Name: MBIST Enable
ITEM.Help_text: Enable or disable Memory MBIST

ITEM.Name: MBIST Test Mode
ITEM.Help_text: Select MBIST Test Mode -Interface Mode (Tests Single and Multiple CS transactions and Basic Connectivity) or Data Eye Mode (Measures Voltage vs. Timing)

ITEM.Name: MBIST Aggressors
ITEM.Help_text: Enable or disable MBIST Aggressor test

ITEM.Name: MBIST Per Bit Slave Die Reporting
ITEM.Help_text: Reports 2D Data Eye Results in ABL Log for each DQ, Chipselect, and Channel

ITEM.Name: Integrated Graphics Controller
ITEM.Help_text: Enable Integrated Graphics controller

ITEM.Name: UMA Mode
ITEM.Help_text: UMA Mode

ITEM.Name: UMA Version
ITEM.Help_text: UMA Legacy Version\nUMA Non Legacy Version\nHybrid Secure

ITEM.Name: Display Resulotuon
ITEM.Help_text: Display Resolution

ITEM.Name: UMA Frame buffer Size
ITEM.Help_text: Set UMA FB size

ITEM.Name: UMA Above 4G
ITEM.Help_text: If requested UMA frame buffer size can't be fit under 4GB or the system has enough available memory above 4GB, this option may be set to TRUE to allow UMA frame buffer size to be allocated successfully.

ITEM.Name: NB Azalia
ITEM.Help_text: Enable Integrate HD Audio controller

ITEM.Name: IOMMU
ITEM.Help_text: Enable/Disable IOMMU

ITEM.Name: System Configuration
ITEM.Help_text: Warning: Select System Configuration may cause the system to hang, as some System Configuration may not be supported by your OPN.\n

ITEM.Name: Fan Control
ITEM.Help_text: Auto = Use the default fan controller settings\nManual = User can set customized fan controller settings

ITEM.Name: Force PWM Control
ITEM.Help_text: Unforce = Do not force the fan PWM\nForce = Force the fan PWM to the use specified value

ITEM.Name: Force PWM
ITEM.Help_text: Specify the PWM to force the fan to [0-100]

ITEM.Name: Fan Table Control
ITEM.Help_text: Auto = Use the default fan table\nManual = User can set customized fan table

ITEM.Name: Low Temperature
ITEM.Help_text: Low Temperature ['C]

ITEM.Name: Medium Temperature
ITEM.Help_text: Medium Temperature ['C]

ITEM.Name: High Temperature
ITEM.Help_text: High Temperature ['C]

ITEM.Name: Critical Temperature
ITEM.Help_text: Critical Temperature ['C]

ITEM.Name: Low Pwm
ITEM.Help_text: Low Pwm [0-100]

ITEM.Name: Medium Pwm
ITEM.Help_text: Medium Pwm [0-100]

ITEM.Name: High Pwm
ITEM.Help_text: High Pwm [0-100]

ITEM.Name: Temperature Hysteresis
ITEM.Help_text: Temperature Hysteresis ['C]

ITEM.Name: Fan Polarity
ITEM.Help_text: 0 = negative\n1 = positive

ITEM.Name: Audio IOs
ITEM.Help_text: Audio IOs control

ITEM.Name: System Temperature Tracking
ITEM.Help_text: System Temperature Tracking [0 = disabled; 1 = enabled]

ITEM.Name: SATA Controller
ITEM.Help_text: Disable or enable OnChip SATA controller

ITEM.Name: SATA Mode
ITEM.Help_text: Select OnChip SATA Type. Don't select RAID for Raven FP5 platform. Raven FP5 doesn't support RAID.

ITEM.Name: Sata RAS Support
ITEM.Help_text: Disable or enable Sata RAS Support
ITEM.Additional_information: B0D11F0 REG48 Enable: set BIT16, BIT17, BIT18 Disable: Clear these three bits

ITEM.Name: Sata Disabled AHCI Prefetch Function
ITEM.Help_text: Disable or enable Sata Disabled AHCI Prefetch Function

ITEM.Name: XHCI0 controller enable
ITEM.Help_text: Enable or disable USB3 controller.

ITEM.Name: XHCI1 controller enable
ITEM.Help_text: Enable or disable USB3 controller.

ITEM.Name: Ac Loss Control
ITEM.Help_text: Select Ac Loss Control Method

ITEM.Name: Uart 0 Enable
ITEM.Help_text: Uart 0 has no HW FC if Uart 2 is enabled

ITEM.Name: Uart 1 Enable
ITEM.Help_text: Uart 1 has no HW FC if Uart 3 is enabled

ITEM.Name: XGBE0 enable
ITEM.Help_text: Enable or disable Ethernet controller.

ITEM.Name: XGBE1 enable
ITEM.Help_text: Enable or disable Ethernet controller.

ITEM.Name: Driver Type
ITEM.Help_text: Bios will select MS driver for SD selections.

ITEM.Name: PT SATA Mode
ITEM.Help_text: Select Promontory SATA Type

ITEM.Name: PT Aggresive SATA Device Sleep Port 0
PT Aggresive SATA Device Sleep Port 1
